error.signature: ERROR: THESE PACKAGES DO NOT MATCH THE HASHES FROM THE REQUIREMENTS FILE
error.regex: PACKAGES DO NOT MATCH THE HASHES|hash.*mismatch|HashMismatchError

verdict.summary: Package hash mismatch in pip 23 occurs when cached or downloaded wheels do not match the hashes specified in requirements. Often caused by stale cache or updated packages on PyPI.

dead_ends.action: Simply retry the install without clearing cache
dead_ends.why_fails: The cached wheel has the wrong hash and will keep being reused
Pip 23 does not support --no-verify; also removes important supply chain security

workarounds.action: Clear pip cache and regenerate hashes: pip cache purge && pip-compile --generate-hashes
workarounds.how: Run pip cache purge to clear stale wheels, then regenerate requirements with correct hashes

workarounds.action: Pin exact package versions with updated hashes using pip hash
workarounds.how: Download the wheel manually, run pip hash <file>.whl, update requirements.txt with new hash

leads_to.condition: when hash regeneration reveals version conflicts

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Hash mismatch means the package was found but its checksum is wrong; no-matching-distribution means the package version was not found at all
